IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO FOSTER STRONG INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES WITH CHRISTIAN VALUES BY PROVIDING QUALITY PROGRAMS THAT STRENGTHEN SPIRIT, MIND AND BODY FOR ALL.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO FOSTER STRONG INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES WITH CHRISTIAN VALUES BY PROVIDING QUALITY PROGRAMS THAT STRENGTH SPIRIT, MIND AND BODY FOR ALL.
IRS990.Description: MEMBERSHIP -WE TURN NO ONE AWAY DUE TO THE INABILITY TO PAY. IN 2010, WE SERVED 6,618 UNDUPLICATED PERSONS IN OUR COMMUNITY AND PROVIDED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND SUBSIDY FOR MEMBERSHIP, PROGRAMS AND OUTREACH, IN THE AMOUNT OF $113,837. MEMBERSHIP PROVIDES FULL FACILITY ACCESS AND INCLUDES REDUCED PROGRAM FEES,PREREGISTRATION BENEFITS, COMPLIMENTARY GROUP EXERCISE CLASSES (BOTH ON LAND AND IN THE POOL), CHILD WATCH WHILE YOU WORK OUT, FREE FITNESS ASSESSMENTS, ORIENTATIONS WITH PERSONAL TRAINING CONSULTATION, AFTER SCHOOL SUPERVISION AND PROGRAMMING, AND PROGRESSIVE SWIM LESSONS FOR FAMILY MEMBERSHIPS.

Activity2.Description: CHILD CARE - OUR CHILD CARE PROGRAMS OFFER HIGH QUALITY CHILD CARE ACTIVITIES FOR INFANTS AND CHILDREN SIX WEEKS OF AGE THROUGH SIXTH GRADE FROM ALL SEGMENTS OF OUR COMMUNITIES. WE OFFER A VARIETY OF STATE LICENSED CHILD CARE PROGRAMS, BOTH FULL AND PART TIME, WHICH PROVIDE A SAFE AND NURTURING ENVIRONMENT WHERE YOUTH CAN DEVELOP SELF ESTEEM, GOOD VALUES AND AN APPRECIATION OF CHARITABLE SERVICE. WOVEN INTO THE FABRIC OF THE YMCA MISSION IS A COMMITMENT TO STRENGTHEN FAMILIES. OUR CHILDCARE PROGRAMS INCLUDE SUPPORT FOR OUR FAMILIES THAT HELP STRENGTHEN THE BONDS TO RAISE CHILDREN THAT ARE HAPPY AND HEALTHY IN SPIRIT, MIND AND BODY. WE PARTNER WITH STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES SO THAT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE FOR THOSE WHO CANNOT AFFORD TO PAY. OUR YMCA RECEIVED $ 214,100 IN GOVERNMENT FUNDING, INCLUDING GRANTS, CONTRACTS AND VOUCHERS TO PROVIDE FRONT-LINE SERVICE THAT RELIEVED THE BURDEN FOR GOVERNMENT TO PROVIDE MANY OF THESE SERVICES. IN 2010, WE PROVIDED CARE TO 328 CHILDREN IN 351 DAYS.

Activity3.Description: YOUTH & FAMILY SERVICES - YMCAS ARE MORE THAN FOUR WALLS OF THEIR FACILITIES; THEY ARE PARTNERS IN BUILDING STRONG KIDS AND TEENS, MEMBERS AND NON-MEMBERS ALIKE. THE FRANKLIN-GROVE CITY YMCA PROMOTES YOUTH AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BY PROVIDING AGE APPROPRIATE PROGRAMS, WITH BOTH PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL OUTCOMES GOALS. OUR TEEN CENTER IS OPEN FOR USE TO ALL WITHOUT A FEE. WE HAVE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES SUCH AS UNITED WAY, AWARE, ROTARY, KIWANIS AND VARIOUS SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO HELP FACILITATE THE ONGOING NEEDS OF OUR AREAS YOUTH. IN 2010, WE SERVED 3,480 UNDUPLICATED CHILDREN 1-17 YEARS OF AGE AND PROVIDED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ALL IN NEED. WE'VE TAUGHT HUNDREDS OF CHILDREN LIFE SAVING SKILLS AND NEARLY 100 LIFEGUARDS TO SAVE SOMEONE FROM DROWNING.

ActivityOther.Description: HEALTH & WELLBEING SERVICE, TEEN CENTER SERVICE, AND AQUATICS CENTERS SERVICE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE YMCA ADOPTED ASC NO. 740 AS IT RELATES TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2010 AND HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS TAKEN FOR ALL OPEN YEARS. CURRENTLY, 2008, 2009, AND 2010 TAX YEARS ARE OPEN AND SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND PENNSYLVANIA BUREAU OF CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS. HOWEVER, THE YMCA IS NOT CURRENTLY UNDER AUDIT NOR HAS THE ORGANIZATION BEEN CONTACTED BY ANY OF THESE JURISDICTIONS. BASED ON THE EVALUATION OF THE YMCA'S TAX POSITIONS, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES ALL POSITIONS TAKEN WOULD BE UPHELD UNDER EXAMINATION. THEREFORE, NO ASSET OR LIABILITY FOR THE EFFECTS OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2010.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED ON FORM 990, PG 9, LINE 8B 36,045.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED ON FORM 990, PG 9, LINE 8B 36,045.
SCHOLARSHIPS NETTED WITH MEMBERSHIP REVENUE ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 113,837.
SCHOLARSHIPS NETTED WITH MEMBERSHIP REVENUE ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 113,837.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS: ASSISTANCE IS GRANTED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED AND FINANCIAL GUIDELINES ARE DETERMINED BY THE APPLICANT'S HOUSEHOLD INCOME AND HARDSHIP. APPLICANTS WHO RESIDE OR WORK IN THE SERVICE AREA OF THE FRANKLIN-GROVE CITY YMCAS SHOULD BE GIVEN PREFERENCE. SCHOLARSHIPS SHOULD BE GRANTED FOR 12 MONTH MEMBERSHIP OR PROGRAM PERIODS AND APPLICANTS ARE REQUESTED TO REAPPLY TO CONTINUE BENEFITS. INDIVIDUALS ARE EXPECTED TO PAY THEIR PORTION TO THE YMCA IN A TIMELY FASHION. THE YMCA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO SUSPEND ALL SERVICES FOR LACK OF PAYMENT. THE YMCA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO TERMINATE OR TO REFUSE ASSISTANCE TO APPLICANTS AS REQUIRED. MONITORING FOR SCHOLARHIPS: THE SCHOLARSHIP SCALE WILL BE CONSIDERED WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED. THE SCALE IS THE FEDERAL GUIDELINES DISTRIBUTED BY THE AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT ANNUALLY. THIS SCALE IS BASED ON INCOME AND FAMILY SIZE. THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE MEMBER AND WILL INCLUDE AT LEAST TWO OF THE FOLLOWING FORMS: A COPY OF THE PRIOR YEAR'S 1040 AND W-2; CURRENT PAY STUBS, AND SOCIAL SECURITY INCOME (SSI) PAYMENT STATEMENT.IF APPROVED, THEIR MEMBERSHIP WILL BE SUBSIDIZED THROUGH THE GENEROSITY OF OUR EVERYDAY HERO DONORS. EACH YEAR WE HOLD A CAMPAIGN TO RAISE FUNDS TO OFFSET THE COST OF A MEMBERSHIP FOR THOSE WHO FINANCIALLY QUALIFY. AS A WAY OF ACKNOWLEDGING OUR DONORS, WE REQUIRE RECIPIENTS OF A SUBSIDIZED MEMBERSHIP TO WRITE A "THANK YOU" WHICH WILL BE SENT TO ONE OF OUR DONORS. IF YOU PREFER TO REMAIN ANONYMOUS, YOU DO NOT NEED TO SIGN THE THANK YOU. SCHOLARSHIP REQUESTS ARE MANAGED BY THE PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIP STAFF WITH ALL HARDSHIP OR UNQUALIFIED APPLICANTS BROUGHT TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR FINAL APPROVAL. A SCHOLARSHIP REPORT WILL BE PROVIDED AS NEEDED AND/OR ANNUALLY TO THE BOARD OF MANAGERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BY LAWS FOR YMCA OF FRANKLIN AND GROVE CITY WAS AMENDED AND APPROVED ON APRIL 29TH, 2010. SEE FOLLOWING FOR CHANGES: 1) ARTICLE VII SECTION 1 - THE CORPORATE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL BE COMPRISED OF BRANCH BOARD OF MANAGERS REPRESENTATIVES FROM EACH BRANCH AND AT-LARGE REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE COMMUNITIES SERVED BY THE CORPORATION, [ADDED: WITH A PREFERENCE TO BE GIVEN TO FACILITY MEMBERS UNLESS THE THEN CURRENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS ACTS TO WAIVE THE PREFERENCE REQUIREMENT IN CONSIDERATION OF THE NEEDS OF THE CORPORATION AND THE QUALIFICATIONS OF THE CANDIDATE.] THESE DIRECTORS SHALL BE DULY ELECTED AT THE ANNUAL CORPORATE MEETING WHICH SHALL BE CHAIRED BY AN OUTGOING SENIOR OFFICER AND HELD [ADDED: BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 15TH AND NOVEMBER 1ST OF]EACH YEAR. 2) ARTICLE VII SECTION 2 - EACH BOARD OF MANAGERS SHALL PROVIDE, NOT MORE THAN ONE WEEK FOLLOWING THE SAID BRANCH'S [ADDED: SEPTEMBER] BOM MEETING, A SLATE OF CANDIDATES. 3) ARTCILE VII SECTION 3 - THE CORPORATE BOARD SHALL BE COMPRISED AS FOLLOWS: 2. EACH BRANCH BOM SHALL SELECT UP TO THREE (3) BOARD OF MANAGER MEMBERS, AT LEAST ONE OF WHOM IS A BOARD OFFICER, AND NO MORE THAN TWO (2) AT LARGE [DELETED:FACILITY] MEMBERS (VII SECTION 1). THE TOTAL NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM AN INDIVIDUAL BRANCH SHALL NOT EXCEED FIVE (5) IN THE SAID BRANCH'S CVO LEADERSHIP YEAR. IN ALL OTHER YEARS, THE TOTAL NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE BRANCH SHALL NOT EXCEED FOUR (4). 3. THE POSITION OF CHIEF VOLUNTEER OFFICER (CVO) SHALL ROTATE BETWEEN BRANCHES [DELETED:ANNUALLY.] HE OR SHE SHALL BE SELECTED FROM THE BRANCH BOARD THAT IS DUE TO HOLD THIS POST FROM THE BRANCH OFFICER(S) REPRESENTED. THE ELECTED CVO HAS SERVED AS A BRANCH BOARD OF MANAGER OFFICER FOR AT LEAST 1 FULL TERM IN THE PREVIOUS TWO YEARS. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTOR IS SELECTED FROM THE OFFICER(S) OF THE ALTERNATING BRANCH. 6. [ADDED: EXCEPT FOR THE CVO], MEMBERSHIP ON THE BOARD IS FOR A ONE YEAR TERM. 4) ARTICLE VIII SECTION 3. - [ADDED: THE TERM OF THE PRESIDENT (CVO) SHALL BE TWO YEARS. THE TERMS OF THE OTHER OFFICERS SHALL BE ONE YEAR.] IN THE EVENT OF AN UNTIMELY VACANCY, THE CVO SHALL APPOINT, WITH CORPORATE BOARD APPROVAL, A REPLACEMENT TO SERVE THE BALANCE OF THE TERM. 5) ARTICLE VIII SECTION 4. - OFFICERS MAY HOLD ANY GIVEN OFFICE FOR NO MORE THAN THREE (3) CONSECUTIVE [INSTEAD OF ONE (1) YEAR] TERMS, UNLESS A MID-TERM EXPIRATION REQUIRES EXTENDING THE FINAL YEAR THROUGH THE NEXT CORPORATE ANNUAL MEETING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE YMCA'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS WILL PRESENT THE FORM 990 IN PROGRESS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 IN PROGRESS AS WELL AS FINAL DRAFT FOR APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR, ALL EMPLOYEES AND BOARD REPRESENTATIVES ARE GIVEN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND ALL DISCLOSE AND SIGN THE DOCUMENT WHICH REMAINS IN THE EMPLOYEES' FILES OR THE CORPORATE FOLDER.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A FORMAL ANNUAL EVALUATION IS PERFORMED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR ALL KEY EMPLOYEES WITH DOCUMENTATION OF SUCH KEPT WITHIN THE EMPLOYEE FILES. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S ANNUAL EVALUATION IS PERFORMED BY THE CORPORATE BOARD CVO AND THE BRANCH BOARD PRESIDENTS. AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR ALL KEY STAFF (DEPARTMENT DIRECTORS) FOR 2009 THROUGH 2010. COMPARABLE DATA WAS OBTAINED FROM REGIONAL YMCAS WITH COMPARABLE BUDGETS AND MEMBERSHIP CONSTITUENCIES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND PRESENTED AT THE ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP MEETING WHICH IS CONDUCTED FOR THE ASSOCIATION IN THE SPRING OF EACH YEAR AND COMPLIANT WITH THE FRANKLIN-GROVE CITY YMCA CORPORATE BYLAWS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED GAINS ON INVESTMENTS: 24,073. DONATED SERVICES AND USE OF FACILITIES: 140,000. DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED ON FORM 990, PG 9, LINE 8B 36,045. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: 200,118.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE ANNUALLY REVIEWS ALL FEDERAL FILING REQUIREMENTS, AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND HAS GENERAL OVERSIGHT OVER THE ENTIRE AUDIT PROCESS.
